org.beiter.michael.crypto4j.pool

Class PoolSpec

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.beiter.michael.crypto4j.pool.PoolSpec

  • public class PoolSpec
extends Object
    This class specifies properties to configure an object pool.

      PoolSpec()
      Constructs an empty spec, with the values being set to the class' default values (DEFAULT_* properties in this class).

      Creates a spec from an existing spec, making a defensive copy.

      boolean isTestWhileIdle() 
      void setAdditionalProperties(Map<String,String> additionalProperties)
      Set additional properties which are not parsed by this class, and for which no getter/setter exists, but which are to be stored in this object nevertheless for later use by other spec classes.
      void setBlockWhenExhausted(boolean blockWhenExhausted)
      True means that the borrow methods blocks when the pool is exhausted (the maximum number of "active" objects has been reached).
      void setEvictionPolicyClassName(String evictionPolicyClassName)
      Sets the name of the org.apache.commons.pool2.impl.EvictionPolicy implementation that is used by this pool.
      void setFairness(boolean fairness)
      Indicates whether or not the pool serves threads waiting to borrow objects fairly.
      void setJmxEnabled(boolean jmxEnabled)
      True means that JMX will be enabled for newly created pools that use this spec
      void setJmxNameBase(String jmxNameBase)
      Set the value of the JMX name base that will be used as part of the name assigned to JMX enabled pools created with this pool spec.
      void setJmxNamePrefix(String jmxNamePrefix)
      Set the value of the JMX name prefix that will be used as part of the name assigned to JMX enabled pools created with this pool spec
      void setLifo(boolean lifo)
      True means that the pool returns the most recently used ("last in") object in the pool (if there are idle objects available).
      void setMaxIdle(int maxIdle)
      The maximum number of objects that can remain idle in the pool, without extra ones being released, or negative for no limit.
      void setMaxTotal(int maxTotal)
      The maximum number of active objects that can be allocated from this pool at the same time, or negative for no limit.
      void setMaxWaitMillis(long maxWaitMillis)
      The maximum number of milliseconds that the pool will block (when there are no available objects) before throwing an exception when the pool is exhausted and isBlockWhenExhausted() is true.
      void setMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis(long minEvictableIdleTimeMillis)
      The minimum amount of time an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle object evictor (if any, see setTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis(long)).
      void setMinIdle(int minIdle)
      The minimum number of objects that can remain idle in the pool, without extra ones being created, or zero to create none.
      void setNumTestsPerEvictionRun(int numTestsPerEvictionRun)
      The maximum number of objects to examine during each run (if any) of the idle object evictor thread.
      void setSoftMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis(long softMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis)
      The minimum amount of time a connection may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle connection evictor, with the extra condition that at least minIdle objects remain in the pool.
      void setTestOnBorrow(boolean testOnBorrow)
      The indication of whether objects will be validated before being borrowed from the pool.
      void setTestOnCreate(boolean testOnCreate)
      The indication of whether objects will be validated after creation.
      void setTestOnReturn(boolean testOnReturn)
      The indication of whether objects will be validated before being returned to the pool.
      void setTestWhileIdle(boolean testWhileIdle)
      The indication of whether objects will be validated by the idle object evictor (if any, see setTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis(long))).
      void setTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis(long timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis)
      The number of milliseconds to sleep between runs of the idle object evictor thread.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PoolSpec

        public PoolSpec()
        Constructs an empty spec, with the values being set to the class' default values (DEFAULT_* properties in this class). Usually this constructor is used if this configuration POJO is populated in an automated fashion (e.g. injection).

        If you need to build them manually (possibly with defaults), use or create a properties builder.

        To change individual fields, use the provided setters.

      • PoolSpec

        public PoolSpec(PoolSpec spec)
        Creates a spec from an existing spec, making a defensive copy.
        Parameters:
        spec - The set of spec to copy
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When spec is null
        See Also:
        PoolSpec()

        The minimum number of objects that can remain idle in the pool, without extra ones being created, or zero to create none.

      • getMaxWaitMillis

        public final long getMaxWaitMillis()
        Returns:
        The maximum number of milliseconds that the pool will wait for a connection
        See Also:
        setMaxWaitMillis(long)

      • setMaxWaitMillis

        public final void setMaxWaitMillis(long maxWaitMillis)
        The maximum number of milliseconds that the pool will block (when there are no available objects) before throwing an exception when the pool is exhausted and isBlockWhenExhausted() is true. Set to -1 to wait indefinitely.
        Parameters:
        maxWaitMillis - The maximum number of milliseconds that the pool will wait for a connection
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - When the provided value of maxWaitMillis is out of range

      • isTestOnCreate

        public final boolean isTestOnCreate()
        Returns:
        The indication of whether objects will be validated after creation
        See Also:
        setTestOnCreate(boolean)

      • setTestOnCreate

        public final void setTestOnCreate(boolean testOnCreate)
        The indication of whether objects will be validated after creation. If the object fails to validate, the borrow attempt that triggered the object creation will fail.
        Parameters:
        testOnCreate - The indication of whether objects will be validated after creation

      • isTestOnBorrow

        public final boolean isTestOnBorrow()
        Returns:
        The indication of whether objects will be validated before being borrowed from the pool
        See Also:
        setTestOnBorrow(boolean)

      • setTestOnBorrow

        public final void setTestOnBorrow(boolean testOnBorrow)
        The indication of whether objects will be validated before being borrowed from the pool. If the object fails to validate, it will be dropped from the pool, and we will attempt to borrow another.
        Parameters:
        testOnBorrow - The indication of whether objects will be validated before being borrowed from the pool

      • isTestOnReturn

        public final boolean isTestOnReturn()
        Returns:
        The indication of whether objects will be validated before being returned to the pool
        See Also:
        setTestOnReturn(boolean)

      • setTestOnReturn

        public final void setTestOnReturn(boolean testOnReturn)
        The indication of whether objects will be validated before being returned to the pool.
        Parameters:
        testOnReturn - The indication of whether objects will be validated before being returned to the pool

      • isTestWhileIdle

        public final boolean isTestWhileIdle()
        Returns:
        The indication of whether objects will be validated by the idle object evictor (if any)
        See Also:
        setTestWhileIdle(boolean)

      • setTestWhileIdle

        public final void setTestWhileIdle(boolean testWhileIdle)
        The indication of whether objects will be validated by the idle object evictor (if any, see setTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis(long))). If an object fails to validate, it will be dropped from the pool.
        Parameters:
        testWhileIdle - The indication of whether objects will be validated by the idle object evictor (if any)

      • getTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis

        public final long getTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis()
        Returns:
        The number of milliseconds to sleep between runs of the idle object evictor thread
        See Also:
        setTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis(long)

      • setTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis

        public final void setTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis(long timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis)
        The number of milliseconds to sleep between runs of the idle object evictor thread. Set to -1 to not run any idle object evictor thread.
        Parameters:
        timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis - The number of milliseconds to sleep between runs of the idle object evictor thread
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - When the provided value of timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis is out of range

      • getNumTestsPerEvictionRun

        public final int getNumTestsPerEvictionRun()
        Returns:
        the number of objects to examine during each run of the idle object evictor thread (if any)
        See Also:
        setNumTestsPerEvictionRun(int)

      • setNumTestsPerEvictionRun

        public final void setNumTestsPerEvictionRun(int numTestsPerEvictionRun)
        The maximum number of objects to examine during each run (if any) of the idle object evictor thread. When positive, the number of tests performed for a run will be the minimum of the configured value and the number of idle instances in the pool. When negative, the number of tests performed will be roughly one nth of the idle objects per run.
        Parameters:
        numTestsPerEvictionRun - The number of objects to examine during each run of the idle object evictor thread (if any)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - When the provided value of numTestsPerEvictionRun is out of range

      • getMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis

        public final long getMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis()
        Returns:
        The minimum amount of time an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligable for eviction by the idle object evictor (if any)
        See Also:
        setMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis(long)

      • setMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis

        public final void setMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis(long minEvictableIdleTimeMillis)
        The minimum amount of time an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle object evictor (if any, see setTimeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis(long)). When non-positive, no objects will be evicted from the pool due to idle time alone.
        Parameters:
        minEvictableIdleTimeMillis - The minimum amount of time an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligable for eviction by the idle object evictor (if any).

      • getSoftMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis

        public final long getSoftMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis()
        Returns:
        The minimum amount of time a connection may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle connection evictor, with the extra condition that at least "minIdle" objects remain in the pool.
        See Also:
        setSoftMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis(long)

      • setSoftMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis

        public final void setSoftMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis(long softMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis)
        The minimum amount of time a connection may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle connection evictor, with the extra condition that at least minIdle objects remain in the pool. When miniEvictableIdleTimeMillis is set to a positive value, miniEvictableIdleTimeMillis is examined first by the idle connection evictor - i.e. when idle objects are visited by the evictor, idle time is first compared against miniEvictableIdleTimeMillis (without considering the number of idle objects in the pool) and then against softMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis, including the minIdle constraint.
        Parameters:
        softMinEvictableIdleTimeMillis - The minimum amount of time a connection may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle connection evictor, with the extra condition that at least "minIdle" objects remain in the pool.

      • getEvictionPolicyClassName

        public final String getEvictionPolicyClassName()
        Returns:
        The fully qualified class name of the EvictionPolicy
        See Also:
        setEvictionPolicyClassName(String)

      • setEvictionPolicyClassName

        public final void setEvictionPolicyClassName(String evictionPolicyClassName)
        Sets the name of the org.apache.commons.pool2.impl.EvictionPolicy implementation that is used by this pool. The pool will attempt to load the class using the thread context class loader. If that fails, the pool will attempt to load the class using the class loader that loaded this class.
        Parameters:
        evictionPolicyClassName - The fully qualified class name of the new eviction policy
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When the evictionPolicyClassName is null
        IllegalArgumentException - When evictionPolicyClassName is empty

      • isLifo

        public final boolean isLifo()
        Returns:
        true if the pool returns the most recently used ("last in") object, false the pool behaves as a FIFO queue
        See Also:
        setLifo(boolean)

      • setLifo

        public final void setLifo(boolean lifo)
        True means that the pool returns the most recently used ("last in") object in the pool (if there are idle objects available). False means that the pool behaves as a FIFO queue - objects are taken from the idle instance pool in the order that they are returned to the pool.
        Parameters:
        lifo - true if the pool returns the most recently used ("last in") object, false if the pool behaves as a FIFO queue

      • isFairness

        public final boolean isFairness()
        Returns:
        true if waiting threads are served as if waiting in a FIFO queue
        See Also:
        setFairness(boolean)

      • setFairness

        public final void setFairness(boolean fairness)
        Indicates whether or not the pool serves threads waiting to borrow objects fairly. True means that waiting threads are served as if waiting in a FIFO queue.
        Parameters:
        fairness - true if waiting threads are to be served by the pool in arrival order

      • isBlockWhenExhausted

        public final boolean isBlockWhenExhausted()
        Returns:
        true if the borrow method should block when the pool is exhausted
        See Also:
        isBlockWhenExhausted()

      • setBlockWhenExhausted

        public final void setBlockWhenExhausted(boolean blockWhenExhausted)
        True means that the borrow methods blocks when the pool is exhausted (the maximum number of "active" objects has been reached).
        Parameters:
        blockWhenExhausted - true if the borrow method should block when the pool is exhausted

      • isJmxEnabled

        public final boolean isJmxEnabled()
        Returns:
        true if JMX will be enabled for newly created pools that use this spec
        See Also:
        setJmxEnabled(boolean)

      • setJmxEnabled

        public final void setJmxEnabled(boolean jmxEnabled)
        True means that JMX will be enabled for newly created pools that use this spec
        Parameters:
        jmxEnabled - true if JMX should be enabled for newly created pools that use this spec

      • getJmxNamePrefix

        public final String getJmxNamePrefix()
        Returns:
        the value of the JMX name prefix
        See Also:
        setJmxNamePrefix(String)

      • setJmxNamePrefix

        public final void setJmxNamePrefix(String jmxNamePrefix)
        Set the value of the JMX name prefix that will be used as part of the name assigned to JMX enabled pools created with this pool spec
        Parameters:
        jmxNamePrefix - The value of the JMX name prefix
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When the jmxNamePrefix is null
        IllegalArgumentException - When jmxNamePrefix is empty

      • getJmxNameBase

        public final String getJmxNameBase()
        Returns:
        The value of the JMX name base, or null if the pool manages the JMX name base
        See Also:
        setJmxNameBase(String)

      • setJmxNameBase

        public final void setJmxNameBase(String jmxNameBase)
        Set the value of the JMX name base that will be used as part of the name assigned to JMX enabled pools created with this pool spec. A value of null means that the pool will define the JMX name base.
        Parameters:
        jmxNameBase - The value of the JMX name base, or null if the pool manages the JMX name base

      • getAdditionalProperties

        public final Map<String,String> getAdditionalProperties()
        Returns:
        Any additional properties stored in this object that have not explicitly been parsed
        See Also:
        setAdditionalProperties(Map)

      • setAdditionalProperties

        public final void setAdditionalProperties(Map<String,String> additionalProperties)
        Set additional properties which are not parsed by this class, and for which no getter/setter exists, but which are to be stored in this object nevertheless for later use by other spec classes.

        This property is commonly used to preserve original properties from upstream components that are to be passed on to downstream components unchanged. This properties set may or may not include properties that have been extracted from the map, and been made available through this POJO.

        Note that these additional properties may be null or empty, even in a fully populated POJO where other properties commonly have values assigned to.

        Parameters:
        additionalProperties - The additional properties to store
